ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There shall be maidens sheltered in tents.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: - with big, black and white beautiful eyes, dwelling in tents.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They are houris (maidens of Paradise), hidden from view, in pavilions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Hur (beautiful, fair females) guarded in pavilions;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Pure ones confined to the pavilions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [There the blessed will live with their] pure companions sheltered in pavilions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Houris (beautiful, fair females) restrained in pavilions;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Maidens (of Paradise, Houris) in cloistered cool pavilions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:72] Houris (hur, this means maidens with intense black eyes set against the [intense] whiteness [of the iris]) secluded, concealed, in pavilions, made of studded gems, annexed to the palaces, like boudoirs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Fair ones, close-guarded) for their husbands (in pavilions) of hollowed pearls.
